_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Facility Policy.  The owners, management, and employees of Atkinson Farm Service, LLC are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, Callaway County LEPC, and/or other authorities, to mitigate and minimize the impacts of the release to the public and the environment.

2.  Facility Information.The primary activity at the facility is the distribution of the prodcut to farmers.  The fertilizer product, anhydrous ammonia, is received, stored and distributed for direct application as a nutrient for crop production.  Anhydrous ammonia is stored in tanks designed for this purpose.

3.  The Accidental Release Prevention Program. The facility follows the provisions of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA),   29 CFR910.111, "Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia" and our State Regulations covering anhydrous ammonia.

4.  The Five-Year Accident History.  There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility, nor to our knowledge, have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries, evacuation, sheltering in place, property damage or environmental damage.

5.  The Emergency Repsonse Program.  The facility has an Emergency Action Plan.  We do not plan to have our employees respond to a major release.  If a large release of anhydrous ammonia takes place at our facility, the response action is to evaculate the area of te release and call 911 and all applicable emergency response numbers listed in our Emergency Action Plan.
 
6.  Planned Changes to Improve Safety. Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility.  Periodic evaluations are performed to access the conditions of the facility. There are no additional specific anhydrous ammonia safety recommendations regarding the storage or the use of anhydrou
s ammonia for implementation at this time.
